intro: Dalzellia attapeuensis, commonly known as the Attapeu dalzellia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Laos. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces woody fruits containing several seeds, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
